title: China Warns Tech Companies About Complying With Trade Restrictions
summary: Beijing has been pushing back against the Trump administration's limits on access to advanced American technology. Chinese authorities summoned some of the world's largest tech companies this week to tell them they could face repercussions if they respond too aggressively to U.S. trade restrictions, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Ash Barty Won by Walking Away
summary: A former tennis phenom's triumph at the French Open follows a break from the grind of the sport. Tennis is a sport with a cruel tradition of devouring its young. Players turn pro at fragile ages, when they should be studying algebra, begging to get driver's permits, or attending awkward dances in gymnasiums.

title: Mexican Business Leaders Express Relief at Deal to Avoid Tariffs
summary: U.S. threat, however, leaves open the possibility of similar ones in the future and could discourage investment. Mexico's business leaders breathed a sigh of relief after the Trump administration dropped its threat to impose tariffs, avoiding an immediate big risk to an economy that was already showing signs of fragility.

title: The Trendy New Way to Organize Your Schedule: A Paper Planner
summary: Paper planners, totems of a pre-digital era, are enjoying a surprising resurgence; 'paper is so calming'. Shelby Abrahamsen, a 26-year-old lifestyle blogger with multiple social media accounts, lives much of her life online. Yet her favorite way to organize her schedule is old-school: She uses two paper planners.

title: Congrats! You Just Beat Djokovic. Now Here's (Gulp) Nadal
summary: Dominic Thiem wins a brilliant two-day five-set match-to earn a final with the greatest clay-court player of them all. Somebody's gotta play Rafael Nadal in the French Open final. It's in the rules; no matter how devastatingly good the guy is on clay surfaces, we can't just hand him this trophy-the exquisitely-titled La Coupe des Mousquetaires, aka The Musketeer's Trophy-without making him beat someone.

title: U.S., Mexico Reach Deal to Avoid Tariffs
summary: President Trump says Mexico has agreed to take 'strong measures' to slow migration over border. President Trump dropped his threat of tariffs on billions of dollars of Mexican imports after negotiators reached a deal on measures to stem the flow of migrants pouring into the U.S. from Mexico, averting a potentially devastating trade fight for both countries.

title: The IPO That Could Reorder the Truck Industry
summary: Why the world of big trucks is about to get shaken up by a small public listing. Volkswagen is finally setting its big-truck division free with a separate stock-market listing. The move could help give the European auto giant a better valuation and even trigger a copycat initiative at its rival Daimler. But the biggest beneficiaries are probably the shareholders of U.S. truck maker Navistar International.

title: Five Things to Watch For at Sunday's Tony Awards
summary: Broadway fans want to know: Can 'Hadestown' edge out 'Tootsie' and 'The Prom' for best musical? Will 'To Kill a Mockingbird' take home a Tony?. By most accounts, Broadway is enjoying a new golden age, an era marked by arty musicals, powerhouse dramas and year after year of record-breaking grosses.

title: Adam Savage Shares His Secrets of Creation
summary: The 'Mythbusters' co-star has a best-selling book, 'Every Tool's a Hammer,' a new show, 'Savage Builds'-and still enjoys blowing things up. Former "Mythbusters" co-star Adam Savage hit the best-seller list in May with his first book, "Every Tool's a Hammer: Life Is What You Make It."

title: Biden Hopes His Third Campaign in Iowa Is the Charm
summary: Although the former vice president is skipping a big gathering on Sunday, he is eager to do better in the state in 2020 than he did in the past. WASHINGTON-Iowa has never been a field of dreams for Joe Biden-and his Democratic presidential rivals are trying to take advantage of that.

title: Trump, Xi to Meet at G-20 as Trade Hostilities Persist
summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin urged China to return to the terms the two countries had been negotiating before talks fell apart. FUKUOKA, Japan-President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping plan to meet at a Group of 20 summit late this month, the U.S. treasury secretary said, offering a prospective break in trade hostilities that are weighing on global growth.

title: Crypto Startups Are Raising Money Again, With a Twist
summary: 'It's like ICO 2.0.': Investors are jumping into initial exchange offerings as cryptocurrency prices rebound. The market for initial coin offerings is mostly dead. Instead, entrepreneurs are flocking to a new way to raise money with digital tokens.

title: Women's World Cup Soccer Kicks Off With France Victory
summary: Defending champ U.S. begins its campaign on Tuesday. PARIS-For most of the soccer season, the far ends of the Parc des Princes stadium here house the hardest core of Paris Saint-Germain fans, the groups that chant the loudest, smuggle in flares, and spark the most fights. Their objective, always, is to make their home as hostile as possible to visiting teams.

title: The Toronto Raptors Are One Win From the NBA Title
summary: It was supposed to be the Warriors' time to shine. Instead the Raptors have a 3-1 lead in the NBA Finals. OAKLAND, Calif.-Before they were an NBA dynasty, the Golden State Warriors were something else: down 2-1.

title: Big Mining Companies Disclose Questionable Stability of Dams
summary: Responding to investors in wake of Brazil disaster, companies detail dams that have raised concerns. Some of the world's largest mining companies said more than a dozen dams under their authority have at times failed stability assessments by outside experts, some of them in locations where a dam break would pose a risk to lives.

title: Some Palestinians Give Up on Their Own State
summary: Trump peace team sees an opening to offer an alternative as people on both sides increasingly give up on the traditional two-state solution. RAMALLAH-When the Trump administration reveals its economic plan for the West Bank and Gaza this month, it hopes to appeal to Palestinians like Amr Marouf, who manages a seafood restaurant here.

title: The Ex-Tennis Pro Who Jump-Started His Training
summary: Crisscross jump rope became an obsession for a former player looking for an alternative cardio exercise. When people first see Pender Murphy working out, they assume he's a boxer or a street performer. Sometimes they start making videos of him on their phone. Sometimes they start applauding.

title: 'Artistic License: Six Takes on the Guggenheim Collection' Review: An Artist-Led Sampler
summary: Contemporary artists choose a fitfully interesting array of works from the museum's holdings.. Exhibitions drawn from a museum's own collections are relatively cheap. They don't require loan negotiations with other institutions, costly extra insurance, or crating and freighting charges. Such shows-in major museums in major cities-are perfect for the summer, when much of the art world has hied off to beaches and country houses, but when regular-folk tourists arrive in droves. They don't care whether the exhibition on view at, say, the Guggenheim Museum in New York, is a revelatory solo show that's going to change the way the artist is considered by art history, or a Whitman's Sampler of goods brought up for air from storage. But even tourists might be less inclined to go to a catch-all exhibition actually titled "Some Stuff Brought up From Storage" than they would to one called "Artistic License: Six Takes on the Guggenheim Collection."

title: Auto Makers Raise Bets in China Despite Market Slowdown
summary: Car giants, local startups see China, the world's largest auto market by sales, as the proving ground for electric vehicles. Three decades of blistering growth in China's auto sales came to a stop last year. But for the big foreign competitors that dominate the market, the country still represents the industry's future.

title: 'It's Going to Be a Year Without Income:' One Farmer Faces the Wettest 12 Months on Record
summary: Resume Subscription. LA RUE, Ohio-Doug Hafer recently spent a few hours picking up softball-size rocks from a field with one of his daughters. He trimmed the bushes at his house, changed a fan motor on the refrigerator after his wife complained it was making a noise, and plans to put a new button on the front doorbell.

title: U.S. Set to Bar Turkey From F-35 Program Over Russian Defense Gear
summary: Letter to Ankara warns against pursuing Russian defense deal. The Pentagon put Turkey on notice that it will cut off Turkish military pilots from training and halt any Turkish purchases of the F-35 fighter jet, defense officials said Friday, exerting new pressure in a widening rift between the two allies.

title: There's a Poem for Every Reader
summary: Instead of trying to define poetry, take pleasure in the many different things poets are able to do with language.. Poetry has been labeled a dying art for almost as long as it has existed: It's not what it used to be, and nobody reads it. Shakespeare's contemporaries wondered if English could ever equal Latin. American poets of the 19th century wondered if they had been superseded by prose. Each time, the doomsayers were at least partly wrong: Shakespeare's era had Shakespeare; after the death of Longfellow came Marianne Moore, T.S. Eliot and Langston Hughes.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Advice That's Been Key for Citi's CFO: 'Careers Are Made in Times of Crisis'
summary: Mark Mason, who helped the bank clean up after the financial crisis, turns to mentors with broader experience who also understand his perspective. Mark Mason's first job was cleaning up weeds on messy lawns. The job that helped define his career was cleaning up assets on the balance sheet of Citigroup Inc.

title: Why Free Is Too High a Price for Facebook and Google
summary: Most of the ills traced to these companies are a direct consequence of their no-cost business models. Over the past two years, Facebook and Google have taken fire for their roles in everything from eroding democratic institutions to damaging mental health to undermining our collective immunity to preventable diseases.

title: The NBA Finals Have Never Seen a Coach Like Nick Nurse
summary: He spent decades in England. He once signed Dennis Rodman as a publicity stunt. Now he's one win away from a title.. OAKLAND, Calif.-The easiest way to understand the differences between the coaches of the two best teams in the NBA is through Dennis Rodman.

title: Stocks Rally After Jobs Data, Closing Strong Week
summary: Dow rises more than 250 points as employment report raises expectations for interest-rate cut. The Dow Jones Industrial Average extended its rally Friday, notching its best week in more than six months, after lackluster employment figures for May fanned investors' expectations of loosened monetary policy.
